StyleCategoryDef.label: Imperial
StyleCategoryDef.description: The refined Imperial style reflects the cosmopolitan culture of Cyrodiil's heartland, featuring elegant designs that blend practical functionality with imperial sophistication.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Colovian
StyleCategoryDef.description: The practical Colovian style embodies the martial traditions of western Cyrodiil's highlands, featuring earth tones and sturdy designs that reflect their straightforward, military-focused culture.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Nibenese
StyleCategoryDef.description: The sophisticated Nibenese style represents the cosmopolitan culture of eastern Cyrodiil, featuring rich colors and elegant designs that reflect their magical aptitude and mercantile traditions.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Imperial Legion
StyleCategoryDef.description: The disciplined Imperial Legion style features standardized military designs with red and gold colors, organized patterns, and symbols of Imperial authority reflecting the Empire's military might.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Breton
StyleCategoryDef.description: The scholarly Breton style embodies the magic-resistant people of High Rock, combining blue and silver academic colors with knightly designs that reflect their mixed elven-human heritage.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Nord
StyleCategoryDef.description: The hardy Nord style represents the fierce warriors of Skyrim, featuring grey and blue practical designs with Nordic patterns suited for harsh climates and independent living.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Redguard
StyleCategoryDef.description: The warrior Redguard style reflects the desert-dwelling fighters of Hammerfell, showcasing brown and bronze colors with curved weapon influences and designs adapted for harsh desert conditions.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Crown
StyleCategoryDef.description: The noble Crown style embodies the traditional aristocracy of Hammerfell, featuring rich ceremonial designs with ancient Yokudan motifs and symbols of noble heritage.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Forebear
StyleCategoryDef.description: The adaptable Forebear style represents the practical Ra Gada descendants, combining traditional Redguard elements with foreign influences and trade-focused aesthetics.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Na-Totambu
StyleCategoryDef.description: The refined Na-Totambu style reflects the most ancient noble bloodlines of Yokuda, featuring the purest traditional designs with elaborate ceremonial elements and royal symbolism.

StyleCategoryDef.label: Ansei
StyleCategoryDef.description: The mystical Ansei style represents the warrior-monks who practice sword-singing, featuring minimalist designs that emphasize the spiritual aspects of blade mastery and martial discipline.
